section.title: Manage Site Resources in one place
section.para: You can easily manage all the site resources in Content Explorer.

Chose
[ Sites Management ]
in General drive. All of your created sites and their resources will be listed in the left pane.
All sites contain typical folders that are site resources:

section.title: CSS Folder
section.para: CSS is one of the default files of a site. This folder contains CSS data that is used to present data in a site and increase that site's content accessibility.

note.title: CSS
note.para: Once a new CSS file is created in a site, it will affect how the site is displayed. For example, if your new CSS file is created with the red background color, the site background will then turn into red.

section.title: Document Folder
section.para: This folder contains all documents used in a site. When you want to add a new document for a site, you can also put them in another folder, but it is recommended to use this one to manage everything easily and conveniently.

section.title: JS Folder
section.para: This is one of the default files of a site. This file contains Java Script data that is used to make a site more animated and more dynamic.

section.title: Links Folder
section.para: This file contains all links used in a site.

section.title: Media Folder
section.para: This folder contains all documents related to videos, images and sounds. It is divided into three sub folders:

listitem.para: This folder contains sound data used in a site.
This folder contains images used in a site.
This folder contains videos used in a site.

section.title: Web Content Folders
section.para: This folder contains all web content used in sites. It is recommended to put all the web content files here, to manage them more easily, or in case you want to reuse them in another site.
